sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: Audit and accountability poli</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as described in the control statements and implementation standard(s).</assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline>High; Moderate; Low</baseline> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>The information system protects audit information and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Audit and Accountability">6887b9fcdb211010280df36f29961951</control_family> <control_name>Protection of Audit Information</control_name> <control_number>AU-09</control_number> <control_type>Mandatory</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>AU-09</group_id> <group_list/> <high>true</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards>High:  Std.1 - Cryptographic mechanisms shall be employed to protect the integrity of audit information (e.g. log, and audit tools).</implementation_standards> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>true</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>true</moderate> <number>ARSC0010881</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:22</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>3</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>Code: 5 U.S.C. §552a(i); FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline; FISCAM: AC-5, AS-2; OMB Memo: M-17-12; OMB Circular A-130: 7.g. and Appendix II; 45 C.F.R. §164.308(a)(1)(ii)(D); 45 C.F.R. §164.312(b)</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>AC-3, AC-6, AU-4(1), MP-2, MP-4, PE-2, P</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Audit information includes all information (e.g., audit records, audit settings, and audit reports) needed to successfully audit information system activity. This control focuses on technical protection of audit information. Physical protection of audit information is addressed by media protection controls and physical and environmental protection controls.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  When audit information contains sensitive information, such as personally identifiable information (PII) or protected health information (PHI), it must be protected commensurate with the information’s confidentiality impact level. Audit information could be necessary to enforce criminal or civil penalties under the Privacy Act. Protecting audit records from compromise by applying this control enhancement helps ensure their availability when needed.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:22</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>6c87b9fcdb211010280df36f2996197d</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:22</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
